archdesc.scopecontent: "How old is Detroit's connection to folks of Italian decent? As old as the city itself. Alfonso Tonti was present at the city's 1701 founding, and since then, thousands of Italian immigrants have chosen us as their new homeland, helping to weave Detroit's colorful tapestry. This DVD contains honest, sometimes controversial interviews with Detroit's most prominent Italian Americans. It follows their footsteps through their toughest challenges, their boom times and tracks them through wars and economic downturns. It traces their seamless integration into business, politics and art, all the while rejoicing in an essential Italian zest for life. 'Our Italian Story' is an in-depth look at Detroit's true pioneers. This is their story, but to Detroiters, it's a proud chapter in 'Our Story'."--Back of case.
